line_1: " But trusts, poor hag! to luck for an ally? —
line_2: "To one who acts and knows no reason why,

line_1: And he had found a ready warm ally;
line_2: As through the goodly train he cast his eye,

line_1: Selfish in good, in ill without ally;
line_2: No social home he knew, no friendship's tie,

line_1: England was then a Friend, and dear ally,
line_2: With her bold Brittains, did their Troops supply;

line_1: Wants, Frailties, Passions, closer still allye
line_2: The common int'rest, or endear the tye:
